data.title: Burkina Faso: country data and statistics
data.meta_description: Burkina Faso in numbers: demographics, economy, energy, climate and more data and comparisons with other countries.
data.text:
Geography

Burkina Faso is a landlocked country in West Africa, south of the Niger arch. The land has a total area of 274,220 km² (105,877 mi²). This land area is approximately 68% of the area of California. Burkina Faso is thus the 29th biggest country in Africa and in terms of area ranked 74th worldwide. Most of the population (68%) resides within rural regions.

Burkina Faso is comparatively low at an average elevation of 297 meters above sea level. The highest elevation in the country (Tena Kourou) is 749 meters. There is no access to the open sea. There are direct national borders with the six neighboring countries Benin, Ivory Coast, Ghana, Mali, Niger and Togo. The distance between New York City and the Capital Ouagadougou is about 7,650 km (4,753 mi).
